com.github.dvdme.GeoCoordinatesLib

Class CoordinatesCalculations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dvdme.GeoCoordinatesLib.CoordinatesCalculations

  • public class CoordinatesCalculations
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class with static method to perform usefull calculations with geographical coordinates
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David

      static boolean isInSquareArea(Coordinates coordinate, Coordinates center, int radius)
      Calculates if target is inside a square area where center is the center of the square and radius is half the side of the square.

      • isInSquareArea

        public static boolean isInSquareArea(Coordinates coordinate,
                                     Coordinates center,
                                     int radius)
        Calculates if target is inside a square area where center is the center of the square and radius is half the side of the square.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - Target coordinate
        center - Center coordinate
        radius - Radius meters
        Returns:
        True or False

      • getDerivedPosition

        public static Coordinates getDerivedPosition(Coordinates coordinate,
                                             double range,
                                             double bearing)
        Calculates the end-point from a given source at a given range (meters) and bearing (degrees). This methods uses simple geometry equations to calculate the end-point.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - Point of origin
        range - Range in meters
        bearing - Bearing in degrees
        Returns:
        End-point from the source given the desired range and bearing.
        See Also:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3695224/sqlite-getting-nearest-locations-with-latitude-and-longitude

      • getDistanceBetweenTwoPoints

        public static double getDistanceBetweenTwoPoints(Coordinates c1,
                                                 Coordinates c2)
        Calculates the distance in meters between two points.
        Parameters:
        c1 - Coordinate one
        c2 - Coordinate two
        Returns:
        The distance in meters
        See Also:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3695224/sqlite-getting-nearest-locations-with-latitude-and-longitude
